input: sentence 1: All the buttons up the back of Dora's plaid dress were buttoned outside-in. Maude should have thought to button her up; but no, she had left poor little Dora to do the best she could, alone. [SEP] sentence 2: She had left poor little Dora to do the best Maude could, alone.

sentence 1: Larry, a timid teen-ager, lives with his widowed mother in a Brooklyn housing project. [SEP] sentence 2: His father's disciple, Antonio, takes Larry under his wing, and quickly molds Larry into a drug runner.

sentence 1: By rolling over in her upper berth, Tatyana could look over the edge of it and see her mother plainly. How very small and straight and rigid she lay in the bunk below!
